markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 12+"
    pfs=""
>
[Darkwood Armor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=141)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 555 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn armor

**Bulk**  varies by armor
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

**Base Material** [Darkwood](/Equipment.aspx?ID=273)

</column>

---

Darkwood armor is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on armor that normally has light Bulk). It’s easier to wear than normal wood armor, reducing the Strength score necessary to ignore its check penalty by 2 and reducing its Speed penalty by 5 feet. (There are no types of wood armor in this book.)

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 12"
pfs="Standard"
>
Darkwood Armor (Standard-Grade)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 555 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 1,600 gp (+160 gp per Bulk)

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

**Craft Requirements** The initial raw materials must include darkwood worth at least 200 gp + 20 gp per Bulk.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 19"
pfs="Standard"
>
Darkwood Armor (High-Grade)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 555 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 32,000 gp (+3,200 gp per Bulk)

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

**Craft Requirements** The initial raw materials must include darkwood worth at least 16,000 gp + 1,600 gp per Bulk.
